author: IAN PATERSON
title: The Darling at The Star has been named one of the best hotels in the world by Forbes
text:
SYDNEY can finally lay claim to a truly world-class luxury hotel to rival the Ritz in Paris and the Four Seasons in New York.
The Darling at The Star has been recognised as one of the world’s best hotels after Forbes Travel Guide yesterday gave it five stars — making it Sydney’s first hotel to receive the coveted award.
The Forbes award differs from the traditional “five stars” seen on online travel websites, most of which are internal industry ratings and therefore less reliable.
media_camera Inside one of the suite’s at The Darling. Picture: Supplied media_camera It’s the first hotel in Sydney to earn the top rating. Picture: Supplied media_camera Even the bathroom boasts great views. Picture: Supplied
Forbes Travel Guide chief executive Gerard Inzerillo said he was extremely happy and proud to announce The Darling as the first property in Sydney to earn the guide’s top rating.
“Only the best properties in the world earn our coveted Five-Star, Four-Star and Recommended awards, and to be rated in that highest category is the ultimate endorsement of the superb service at The Darling,” Mr Inzerillo said.
The Langham Sydney and Park Hyatt received a Four Star rating, while the InterContinental Sydney, InterContinental Double Bay and Shangri-La were given a Recommended rating, meaning they are excellent properties offering consistently good service and facilities.
Six Best-Rated Hotels In The World 2:23 These six hotels are the best in the world, according to Expedia rankings determined by two million verified customer reviews. Photo: AP
July 28th 2015 2 years ago /video/video.news.com.au/Travel/ Six best-rated hotels in the world in 2015. The Darling was judged by Forbes as having virtually flawless service and outstanding facilities.
The Star hotels general manager John Autelitano said the award was a real coup not just for The Star but for Sydney as a whole.
“This is the pinnacle of our industry,” he said. “Forbes have been doing this for quite some time and there are only about 140 Five Star hotels around the world.”
Regarded as the world authority on luxury, the Forbes Travel Guide has been flying anonymous inspectors across the globe to assess ­hotels against a series of 800 objective standards since 1958.
media_camera Forbes have judged the hotel as having virtually flawless service and outstanding facilities. Picture: Supplied media_camera Belinda McWilliam with cocktails inside the penthouse. Picture: Adam Taylor
The standards are among the most stringent in the hospitality industry, with the inspectors staying two nights and three days at each hotel and going to extraordinary lengths to test the staff.
Some of these tests include leaving subtle fingerprints on bathroom mirrors to see if they are cleaned, leaving clothes all over the room to check if staff will collect them, fold them up and put them on the bed, and quizzing front of house staff with unusual requests.
The only other Forber Five Star hotel in Australia is Crown Towers Melbourne at the Crown Casino.
